meanings.sent1: The runner felt dyspnoic after sprinting up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The patient's dyspnoic condition improved with the help of oxygen therapy.
meanings.sent3: The dyspnoic puppy panted heavily after chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The mountain climber faced a dyspnoic challenge as he ascended to higher altitudes.
meanings.sent5: The elderly man's dyspnoic struggle was evident as he climbed the stairs slowly.

meanings.definition: relating to or characterized by dyspnea
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the dyspnoic symptoms to the concerned family.
meanings.sent2: The researcher studied the dyspnoic effects of pollution on respiratory health.
meanings.sent3: The dyspnoic sound of the wheezing engine made the mechanic frown.
meanings.sent4: The city's dyspnoic traffic congestion mirrored the chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The dyspnoic atmosphere in the room made it hard to focus on the presentation.
